Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the body and rim of an orange-red pottery bowl with rounded base, slightly flaring sides and everted and grooved ledge-rim, the fabric is grey in section, both the interior and the exterior are covered with a red-brown slip, the rim is decorated with four black-painted dots on an off-white ground, the exterior is elaborated with one line of incised Coptic text.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell & J. Faiers
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394845) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394845)
